alert.note: Alert for Baxter; Marion; Newton; Pope; Searcy; Stone; Van Buren (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 9:28AM CDT until March 30 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Stone County in north central Arkansas... Searcy County in north central Arkansas... Southeastern Newton County in north central Arkansas... Southeastern Marion County in north central Arkansas... Northwestern Van Buren County in north central Arkansas... Southeastern Baxter County in north central Arkansas... Northeastern Pope County in central Arkansas... * Until 1015 AM CDT. * At 927 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Point Peter to Witts Spring to near Solo, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Marshall... Norfork... Salesville... Briarcliff... Marsena... Witts Spring... Rocky Hill... Duff... Dabney... Point Peter... Herron... Maumee... Advance... Cartney... Bohannon... Imo... Culp... Elberta... Watts... Blanchard Springs Campground... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for central and north central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for central and north central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Baxter; Marion; Newton; Pope; Searcy; Stone; Van Buren
